title: [K-12] BIM Technology-Based Civic Competency Development Course in Construction: Focused on Social Infrastructure Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic theoretical knowledge and practical experience in architecture/engineering/construction, foundational understanding of social infrastructure (public facilities, urban planning, etc.)
context.additional_context: Establishing a Practical Learning Environment Using Digital Devices (Tablets, Laptops, etc.), with Team-Based Collaborative Learning Based on Actual Project Cases. Analyzing BIM Technology Applications for Solving Local Community Issues and Experiencing Citizen-Participatory Design Processes

learning_goals: Competency in 3D modeling and data management of social infrastructure (roads, bridges, public facilities, etc.) is secured by utilizing core BIM software functions.

Using PBL (problem-based learning), learners select real construction project problems (e.g., bridge design, school space improvement), collaborate in 4-person teams for 6 weeks, document the problem-solving process, present within 5 minutes at the final session, and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least three of five evaluation rubric items (creativity, collaboration, technical completeness, social impact, presentation effectiveness).

Strengthening communication competencies across the entire BIM-based design, construction, and maintenance lifecycle: Cultivating effective communication skills with stakeholders (citizens, public officials, engineers, etc.).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
